intro: Astragalus bojnurdensis, commonly known as the Bojnurd milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat. Its scientific study contributes to understanding plant adaptations in extreme climates.
